title: [POST–001] Design session summary UX
body:
## User Story
As a **user of CyberOctopus**
I want a clear session summary screen when my lab is ending
So that I can understand uptime, results, and evidence produced.

## Description
- Display lab uptime
- Display number of evidence artifacts
- Provide textarea for user notes
- "Request Extension" and "End and Collect Evidence" actions
- Ensure layout matches dark-themed UI mockup

## Acceptance Criteria
- Summary screen renders on desktop cleanly
- Uptime is fetched from backend reliably
- Evidence count matches backend artifact index
- Notes are optional and persisted if provided
- Action buttons trigger correct backend events

title: [POST–002] Implement backend session status + uptime API
body:
## User Story
As a **backend engineer**
I want an authoritative API for session uptime and state
So that the summary screen and lifecycle logic remain accurate.

## Description
- Track laboratory session start time, end time, and state
- Provide uptime calculation in API response
- Expose evidence count from evidence store
- Enforce tenant scoping on all queries

## Acceptance Criteria
- GET /lab/{id}/summary returns uptime, evidence_count, and state
- Users can only access sessions within their tenant
- Health and error handling documented
- OpenAPI updated

title: [POST–003] Implement request extension workflow
body:
## User Story
As a **user**
I want to request a TTL extension
So that I can continue my lab beyond its initial time.

## Description
- Add POST /lab/{id}/extend endpoint
- Validate TTL against tenant policies
- Update session expiry time
- Notify UI of new expiry

## Acceptance Criteria
- Extension requests that exceed policy cap return 400 with explanation
- Successful extension updates TTL and appears in UI
- Events logged with tenant and user info
- Tests cover allowed and denied extensions

title: [POST–004] End session and trigger evidence collection
body:
## User Story
As a **user**
I want to end my session and collect all evidence
So that I can download logs, pcaps, and artifacts safely.

## Description
- POST /lab/{id}/end endpoint
- Job queue: collect logs, pcaps, PoC output, timestamps, user notes
- Package evidence into downloadable archive
- Switch session to "ending" then "ended" state

## Acceptance Criteria
- Evidence bundled into a structured archive (logs/, pcaps/, metadata.json)
- Sensitive data redacted before export
- Session resources shut down after evidence collection
- Event audit trail recorded (end_time, user_id, tenant_id)

title: [POST–005] Implement evidence artifact indexing + storage layer
body:
## User Story
As a **platform owner**
I want a consistent structure for evidence artifacts
So that exports, audits, and reviews are easy.

## Description
- Define artifact schema (type, timestamp, path, metadata)
- Store artifacts in S3/minio or local store
- Index artifacts per lab_id and user_id
- Make sure artifacts are tenant-isolated

## Acceptance Criteria
- Artifacts appear in API with correct metadata
- No tenant can access another tenant's evidence
- Large artifacts streamed rather than fully loaded in memory
- Tests for access control and storage integrity

title: [POST–006] Evidence download UI + backend integration
body:
## User Story
As a **user**
I want to download my session evidence bundle
So that I can submit it to managers or attach it to reports.

## Description
- Add UI download action after evidence bundle ready
- Show evidence count and size
- Show spinner while evidence bundle is generating

## Acceptance Criteria
- UI shows a downloadable artifact when backend job completes
- Links expire after TTL for security
- Errors (e.g., artifact missing) are graceful
- Backend enforces auth + tenant scoping

title: [POST–007] Automatic cleanup after session ends
body:
## User Story
As a **platform operator**
I want labs to clean up automatically after shutdown
So that no abandoned resources remain running.

## Description
- Destroy container stack
- Clean up volumes if user has exported evidence
- Update session state to 'cleaned'
- Handle failure modes safely (retry, fallback)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Cleanup runs reliably after evidence job completes
- Any failure triggers retry with exponential backoff
- Logs capture cleanup steps without exposing secrets
- Tests verify no orphaned containers remain
